conclusion: The task is to predict which container (D or E) liquid will flow into after passing through baffles from points A, B, and C.
The image shows three inflow points (A, B, C) at the top and two outflow containers (D, E) at the bottom. The space between them contains slanted baffles of various colors.
The baffle below A is slanted left-downward, guiding flow toward the left side.
The liquid from A will flow left-downward and reach the left-most exit (D).
The baffle below B is slanted rightward, followed by another baffle slanted leftward.
The liquid from B will be diverted rightward, then leftward, and will land in the left-most exit (D).
The baffles below C guide the flow almost straight downward, with the last baffle slanted toward the right-most exit.
The liquid from C will flow straight down and be guided into the right-most outlet (E).
Final answer: Outflow A ⟶ container D, Outflow B ⟶ container D, Outflow C ⟶ container E.
